meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny!

Alright, let's dive into the world of Capes, shall we? I've got my trusty cape (just kidding, it's just a regular ol' gaming hat) and my favorite review-slash-poke-fun-at-others tone. So, without further ado, here's my take on this superhero-flavored turn-based tactical combat game.

First off, let me say that the folks at IGN are onto something with their glowing 80-point review. Those caped crusaders (get it?) have indeed crafted a clever and challenging experience that'll keep you hooked from start to finish. I mean, who doesn't love watching those action figure-like characters combine their powers and supercharge their ultimate abilities? It's like a digital version of me trying to coordinate with my friends during a game night – chaos ensues!

And don't even get me started on the optional objectives in each mission! Chasing those bad guys is like trying to find the perfect meme online – it's all about timing, strategy, and a dash of luck. Stealth missions might not be the most effective (shhh, don't tell anyone I said that), but hey, they're mostly optional, right?

Now, let's talk about some of those other critics. *wink* It seems like Gaming Age was a bit more...underwhelmed by Capes' overall package. Maybe it's because their expectations were too high (get it? High? Like a superhero cape?), or perhaps they just wanted something more out of the box. Either way, I'm not here to disagree with them – we all have our own opinions, and that's what makes gaming so wonderful!

On the other end of the spectrum, Worth Playing seems to have had a blast playing Capes. I mean, who wouldn't want their heroes to start off with more power from the get-go? It's like being the first person to get a new game – you're all set for an awesome adventure! The plot and characters might be a bit...predictable (okay, I'll stop), but hey, it's not about that; it's about having fun!

And then there are those Vandal folks. *chuckles* Quotation forthcoming? More like quotation withheld due to lack of creativity, am I right?

Last but definitely not least, we have PC Gamer and Hardcore Gamer raving about Capes' visuals, gameplay mechanics, and narrative. I mean, what's not to love about a game that promises hours of engaging gameplay and delivers on that promise? It's like me when I'm playing a new game – all enthusiasm, no regrets!

And finally, we have GameStar with their 67-point review. *shrugs* Quotation forthcoming? Yeah, okay, let's just say they're trying to be cool by not sharing their thoughts with the world.

In conclusion (finally!), Capes is an absolute blast! It's like a superhero party in your hands – colorful visuals, engaging gameplay, and a narrative that'll keep you hooked. And hey, who knows? You might even find yourself wearing a cape or two while playing this game!

So, what are you waiting for? Go get your cape on (just kidding again) and start playing Capes today!
